After thinking about it, this PR doesn't do what's expected. core eats the contents of the byte buffer that gets passed in to send_message, so just keeping the byte buffer reference alive at the C++ layer doesn't do what we want.

Either we have to do a ByteBuffer copy before calling into core (since core eats the send message) or the interceptor code needs to do that copy if it cares. However, byte buffer copy is not a deep copy (and I have a benchmark showing that it's size independent) so I'd prefer to only let the interceptor do it when it actually wants that data later.
